definition: perpetual calendar/ten thousand year calendar/Islamic calendar introduced to Yuan China by Jamal al-Din 紮馬剌丁|扎马剌丁

sentences.english: The coal mining area around Jiaozuo City has a history of nearly 100 years.
sentences.chinese: 焦作市煤礦區是一個有着近百年曆史的老礦區。

sentences.english: Peking Opera in China has a history of approximately 200 years.
sentences.chinese: 京劇在中國約有200年曆史，它是北京的地方戲。

sentences.english: The most ancient barn here has a history of 300 years.
sentences.chinese: 當地最古老的禾倉，已有300年曆史。

sentences.english: Furong Town is an ancient town with more than 2000 years of history.
sentences.chinese: 芙蓉鎮是一個具有2000多年曆史的古鎮。

sentences.english: Inside the first hall is a 200-year-old Maitreya Buddha.
sentences.chinese: 在第一個殿裏有一尊200年曆史的彌勒佛。

sentences.english: Crisp skin cakes and ice skin mooncakes only decades of history.
sentences.chinese: 酥皮月餅和冰皮月餅只有數十年曆史。

sentences.english: Shanghai is Chinese piano industry headstream , history having close century so far already.
sentences.chinese: 上海是中國鋼琴工業的發源地，至今已有近百年曆史。

sentences.english: They support the 130-year-old idea of their countryman Dmitri Mendeleev.
sentences.chinese: 他們支持他們同胞門捷列夫有130年曆史的觀點。

sentences.english: The history of Tan's Cuisine has exceeded a hundred years. It is an outstanding branch of Cantonese cuisine.
sentences.chinese: 譚家菜已有百餘年曆史，是粵式風味菜中的一朵奇葩。

sentences.english: Taiyuan is to have a 2400-year-old ancient city.
sentences.chinese: 太原是一座具有2400多年曆史的古城。

sentences.english: FEC is developed from former Fushun Excavator Works, who had a century's history.
sentences.chinese: 公司前身是有百年曆史的撫順挖掘機廠。

sentences.english: The treatment of spent alkali liquor with wet air oxidation (WAO) has been developed for some years.
sentences.chinese: 應用溼式主氣氧化處理廢鹼液已有多年曆史。

sentences.english: You may not believe it but this construction is 500 years old.
sentences.chinese: 你肯定不相信，但是這屋子真的有500年曆史了。

definition: first organized/to run sth for the first time
golden years (after the age of about 60)
to call for entries and select the best/to solicit (entries, submissions, applications etc)/to select (the best candidate)/contest/competition
to make up and go on stage (idiom); to embark on a career (esp. in politics or crime)
photobook (loanword from Japanese), generally sexy portraits of an actress or model
